      • validateUserCredentials

        public boolean validateUserCredentials​(java.lang.String username,
                                       java.lang.String password1,
                                       java.lang.String password2)
        Validates the user credentials which user has given in the registration view. Uses three different methods for validating.
        Parameters:
        username - - user input for username
        password1 - - user input for password
        password2 - - user input for repeated password
        Returns:
        true, if the user credentials can be used for registration

      • createNewUser

        public void createNewUser​(java.lang.String username,
                          java.lang.String password)
        Creates a new user and adds it to userTable in Database
        Parameters:
        username - - Username of added user
        password - - Password of added user

      • isValidUsername

        public boolean isValidUsername​(java.lang.String username)
        Method for validating the username which user has input. Checks if username is unique and if so, checks if the lenght meets the requirements. If username is not usable, sets an errormessage which is then returned to the UI via controller
        Parameters:
        username - - String which user has given as an input
        Returns:
        true if username is valid for creating a user

      • isValidPassword

        public boolean isValidPassword​(java.lang.String password)
        Method for validating the password which user has input. If password is not usable, sets an errormessage which is then returned to the UI via controller
        Parameters:
        password - String which user has given as an input
        Returns:
        true id password is valid for creating a user

      • passwordsMatch

        public boolean passwordsMatch​(java.lang.String password1,
                              java.lang.String password2)
        Method for checking if the passwords user input match with each other. If passwords do not match, sets an errormessage which is then returned to the UI via controller
        Parameters:
        password1 - String which user has given as an input
        password2 - String which user has given as an input when repeating the password
        Returns:
        true if passwords match

      • setErrorMessage

        public void setErrorMessage​(java.lang.String message)
        Method for setting an errorMessage for the user Method is possibly used in the username/password validation methods
        Parameters:
        message - String which is used as an errormessage

        public boolean login​(java.lang.String username,

        Checks the user credentials and if correct, logs the user in
        Parameters:
        username - given username
        password - given password
        Returns:
        true, if the login was successful

      • validatePassWordChange

        public boolean validatePassWordChange​(java.lang.String oldPassword,
                                      java.lang.String newPassword,
                                      java.lang.String newPasswordRepeated)
        Validates if 1. the old password given as input matches the users password 2. the new password given as input is valid for use 3. the new password and repeated new password match with one another
        Parameters:
        oldPassword - the old password given
        newPassword - the new password given
        newPasswordRepeated - repeated new password
        Returns:
        true, if all three inputs are valid

      • changePassword

        public boolean changePassword​(java.lang.String newPassword)
        Changes the users password and gives an errormessage if something goes wrong with the change
        Parameters:
        newPassword - the new password given
        Returns:
        true, if the password was changed successfully
